title: How to stop consuming content and start creating it - Quora

response.answer_text: YOU HAVE TO FIND YOUR REASON WHY! Often we tend to find a reason to ‘why not’ which is often an easy distraction. Content creators job is to keep you distracted. I’m not trying motivational crap….I’m begging you to just do it! For me when I was 5 years old I remember grabbing a partial eaten donut out of the dumpster and that’s my why! I’m afraid my family will ever experience that! The first thing in the morning and the last thing every night I see that one moment in time. No matter how much have…the why keeps me on fire to do more! Now, it doesn’t matter if you want a new house or a better cup of coffee, when your why becomes the most important thing… …then the second important thing. I was blogging one day and a reader who happened to be working in the Middle East message me of being in extreme danger…I used contacts that were barely internet friends to go and get him. A why. I wrote something checking my email and a person told me that they were going to end it all and my message made them stop. We got together now that person is doing better than I am online! A why. If you have kids that you want to give the world to….that’s your why! A vacation you never had….a deserved why. Just to not be worried about bills is why enough… I wish you the best!

Have you ever heard the saying that goes something like, To learn how to write - read? Don’t stop consuming. Just arrange the consumption alongside the creation. Share your time between them. Read something and then re-write it in your own words. It gets you creating and it helps internalize the content.
